skill.summary: Japanese guide skill for non-technical users to navigate development through natural language questions.
skill.author: Chachamaru127

security_audit.summary: All static findings are false positives. This is a documentation-only guidance skill containing Japanese response patterns. No executable code, no cryptographic operations, no command execution. The 'network' flag references a GitHub URL in metadata (legitimate). The 'external_commands' flag references Markdown backticks for code formatting, not shell execution.

content.value_statement: Non-technical users often feel stuck during software development. This skill provides guided responses to natural language questions like 'what should I do?' or 'how do I proceed?', helping VibeCoders navigate the development workflow.
actual_capabilities: Responds to natural language questions about what to do next in a project
Detects project state (no project, plan exists, task in progress, phase complete, or error)
Provides context-appropriate response patterns with example phrases in Japanese and English
Checks AGENTS.md and Plans.md to understand current project status
Detects WIP markers and recent errors to determine appropriate guidance
limitations: This is a deprecated legacy version superseded by vibecoder-guide skill
Only responds to natural language triggers, does not execute code
Cannot modify files or run commands directly
Designed specifically for Japanese-speaking non-technical users

use_cases.title: New Project Initialization
use_cases.description: When a VibeCoder asks 'what should I do?' without an active project, this skill guides them to describe their goals and start a new project.
use_cases.target_user: Users new to software development who need guidance on getting started

use_cases.title: Workflow Navigation
use_cases.description: When users ask 'what's next?' or 'continue' during active work, this skill shows appropriate next steps based on their current progress.
use_cases.target_user: Users working through a development plan who need direction

use_cases.title: Error Recovery
use_cases.description: When errors occur and users ask for help, this skill provides options to fix, explain, or skip the current issue.
use_cases.target_user: Users who encounter problems and need guidance on how to proceed

prompt_templates.title: Basic Help Request
prompt_templates.scenario: User is unsure what to do next in their project

prompt_templates.title: Continue Work
prompt_templates.scenario: User completed a task and wants to know the next step

prompt_templates.title: Error Assistance
prompt_templates.scenario: User encountered an issue and needs guidance

prompt_templates.title: Full Task Completion
prompt_templates.scenario: User wants to delegate remaining work to the AI

best_practices: Use natural language in Japanese or English - the skill understands both
Ask for clarification when unsure about next steps rather than guessing
Check AGENTS.md and Plans.md to understand project context before answering
anti_patterns: Do not load this skill for technical tasks requiring direct code implementation
Do not load for code review requests - this is a beginner guidance skill
Do not expect this skill to execute commands - it only provides guidance

faq.question: What is VibeCoder?
faq.answer: VibeCoder refers to non-technical users who develop software through natural language conversations with AI, without needing to write code themselves.

faq.question: When should I use this skill?
faq.answer: Use when users ask questions like 'what should I do?', 'what's next?', 'how do I proceed?', or express confusion about their next step.

faq.question: Does this skill write code?
faq.answer: No, this skill only provides guidance and response patterns. It does not execute code or modify files directly.

faq.question: What languages does this skill support?
faq.answer: The skill is designed for Japanese speakers but also responds to English trigger phrases like 'help' and 'what should I do?'.

faq.question: How does it determine the right response?
faq.answer: It checks AGENTS.md for project initialization, Plans.md for planning status, WIP markers for task progress, and recent errors for problem state.

faq.question: Is this skill still active?
faq.answer: This is a deprecated legacy version. The vibecoder-guide skill supersedes this one with improved functionality.
